016package squidpony.squidmath;
017
018import squidpony.ArrayTools;
019import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
020import squidpony.annotation.GwtIncompatible;
021
022import java.io.Serializable;
023import java.util.*;
024
025/**
026 * A bi-directional mapping of non-unique objects to positions in an ordering (which this generates), and vice versa.
027 * This class is very similar to {@link Arrangement}, but is bag-like instead of set-like, allowing repeats of the same
028 * key with different positions in the ordering. Useful for various indirection techniques where you want to be able to
029 * retrieve a value in several ways, such as with  multiple MultiArrangements all sharing the same ordering but with
030 * different types for keys.
031 * <br>
032 * Originally, this started as a generic linked hash map with with a fast implementation, originally from fastutil as
033 * Object2IntLinkedOpenHashMap but modified to support indexed access. The code is extremely close to {@link OrderedMap},
034 * and like OrderedMap you can look up keys by index, but this is specialized to int values which it can automatically assign.
035 * <br>
036 * <p>Instances of this class use a hash table to represent a map. The table is filled up to a specified <em>load factor</em>, and then doubled in size to accommodate new entries. If the table is
037 * emptied below <em>one fourth</em> of the load factor, it is halved in size. However, halving is not performed when deleting entries from an iterator, as it would interfere with the iteration
038 * process.
039 * </p>
040 * <p>Note that {@link #clear()} does not modify the hash table size. Rather, a family of {@linkplain #trim() trimming methods} lets you control the size of the table; this is particularly useful if
041 * you reuse instances of this class.
042 * </p>
043 * <p>Iterators generated by this map will enumerate pairs in the same order in which they have been added to the map (addition of pairs whose key is already present in the set does not change the
044 * iteration order). Note that this order has nothing in common with the natural order of the keys. The order is kept by means of a int-specialized list, {@link IntVLA}, and is modifiable with this
045 * class' {@link #reorder(int...)} and {@link #shuffle(IRNG)} methods, among other tools.
046 * </p>
047 * <p>This class implements the interface of a sorted map, so to allow easy access of the iteration order: for instance, you can get the first key in iteration order with {@code firstKey()} without
048 * having to create an iterator; however, this class partially violates the {@link SortedMap} contract because all submap methods throw an exception and {@link #comparator()} returns always
049 * <code>null</code>.
050 * </p>
051 * <p>
052 * Additional methods, such as <code>getAndMoveToFirst()</code>, make it easy to use instances of this class as a cache (e.g., with LRU policy).
053 * </p>
054 * <br>
055 * Thank you, Sebastiano Vigna, for making FastUtil available to the public with such high quality.
056 * <br>
057 * See https://github.com/vigna/fastutil for the original library.
058 *
059 * @author Sebastiano Vigna (responsible for all the hard parts)
060 * @author Tommy Ettinger (mostly responsible for squashing several layers of parent classes into one monster class)
061 */
062@Beta
063public class MultiArrangement<K> implements Iterable<K>, Serializable, Cloneable {
064    private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
065    /**
066     * The array of keys.
067     */
068    protected K[] key;
069    /**
070     * The array of values.
071     */
072    protected IntVLA[] value;
073    /**
074     * The mask for wrapping a position counter.
075     */
076    protected int mask;
077    /**
078     * Whether this set contains the key zero.
079     */
080    protected boolean containsNullKey;
081    /**
082     * The index of the first entry in iteration order. It is valid iff {@link #size} is nonzero; otherwise, it contains -1.
083     */
084    protected int first = -1;
085    /**
086     * The index of the last entry in iteration order. It is valid iff {@link #size} is nonzero; otherwise, it contains -1.
087     */
088    protected int last = -1;
089
090    protected IntVLA order;
091    /**
092     * The current table size.
093     */
094    protected int n;
095    /**
096     * Threshold after which we rehash. It must be the table size times {@link #f}.
097     */
098    protected int maxFill;
099    /**
100     * Number of entries in the set (including the key zero, if present).
101     */
102    protected int size;
103    /**
104     * The acceptable load factor.
105     */
106    public final float f;
107
108    /**
109     * Cached set of keys.
110     */
111    protected volatile KeyList keys;
112    /**
113     * Cached collection of values.
114     */
115    protected volatile IntVLA values;
116    /**
117     * Default return value.
118     */
119    protected final int defRetValue = -1;
120
121    /**
122     * The initial default size of a hash table.
123     */
124    public static final int DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE = 16;
125    /**
126     * The default load factor of a hash table.
127     */
128    public static final float DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR = .75f; // .375f // .1875f; // .75f;
129    /**
130     * The load factor for a (usually small) table that is meant to be particularly fast.
131     */
132    public static final float FAST_LOAD_FACTOR = .5f;
133    /**
134     * The load factor for a (usually very small) table that is meant to be extremely fast.
135     */
136    public static final float VERY_FAST_LOAD_FACTOR = .25f;
137
138    protected CrossHash.IHasher hasher = null;
139
140    /**
141     * Creates a new MultiArrangement.
142     * <p>
143     * <p>The actual table size will be the least power of two greater than <code>expected</code>/<code>f</code>.
144     *
145     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the hash set.
146     * @param f        the load factor.
147     */
148
149    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
150    public MultiArrangement(final int expected, final float f) {
151        if (f <= 0 || f > 1)
152            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Load factor must be greater than 0 and smaller than or equal to 1");
153        if (expected < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The expected number of elements must be nonnegative");
154        this.f = f;
155        n = arraySize(expected, f);
156        mask = n - 1;
157        maxFill = maxFill(n, f);
158        key = (K[]) new Object[n + 1];
159        value = new IntVLA[n + 1];
160        //link = new long[n + 1];
161        order = new IntVLA(expected);
162        hasher = CrossHash.defaultHasher;
163    }
164
165    /**
166     * Creates a new MultiArrangement with 0.5f as load factor.
167     *
168     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the MultiArrangement.
169     */
170    public MultiArrangement(final int expected) {
171        this(expected, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * Creates a new MultiArrangement with initial expected 16 entries and 0.5f as load factor.
176     */
177    public MultiArrangement() {
178        this(DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
179    }
180
181
182    public MultiArrangement(final MultiArrangement<? extends K> a) {
183        this(a.size(), a.f, a.hasher);
184        ensureCapacity(a.size()); // The resulting map will be sized for
185        System.arraycopy(a.key, 0, key, 0, a.key.length);
186        System.arraycopy(a.value, 0, value, 0, a.value.length);
187        order.addAll(a.order);
188        containsNullKey = a.containsNullKey;
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Creates a new MultiArrangement using the elements of an array.
193     *
194     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new MultiArrangement.
195     * @param f the load factor.
196     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
197     */
198    public MultiArrangement(final K[] keyArray, final float f) {
199        this(keyArray.length, f);
200        for (int i = 0; i < keyArray.length; i++)
201            add(keyArray[i]);
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Creates a new Arrangement using the elements of an array.
206     *
207     * @param keyColl the collection of keys of the new Arrangement.
208     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
209     */
210    public MultiArrangement(final Collection<K> keyColl) {
211        this(keyColl, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
212    }
213    /**
214     * Creates a new Arrangement using the given collection of keys.
215     *
216     * @param keyColl the collection of keys of the new Arrangement.
217     * @param f the load factor.
218     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
219     */
220    public MultiArrangement(final Collection<K> keyColl, final float f) {
221        this(keyColl.size(), f);
222        Iterator<K> ki = keyColl.iterator();
223        int idx = 0;
224        while (ki.hasNext())
225        {
226            add(ki.next());
227        }
228    }
229
230    /**
231     * Creates a new Arrangement with 0.5f as load factor using the elements of an array.
232     *
233     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new Arrangement.
234     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
235     */
236    public MultiArrangement(final K[] keyArray) {
237        this(keyArray, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Creates a new Arrangement.
242     * <p>
243     * <p>The actual table size will be the least power of two greater than <code>expected</code>/<code>f</code>.
244     *
245     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the hash set.
246     * @param f        the load factor.
247     * @param hasher used to hash items; typically only needed when K is an array, where CrossHash has implementations
248     */
249    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
250    public MultiArrangement(final int expected, final float f, CrossHash.IHasher hasher) {
251        if (f <= 0 || f > 1)
252            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Load factor must be greater than 0 and smaller than or equal to 1");
253        if (expected < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The expected number of elements must be nonnegative");
254        this.f = f;
255        n = arraySize(expected, f);
256        mask = n - 1;
257        maxFill = maxFill(n, f);
258        key = (K[]) new Object[n + 1];
259        value = new IntVLA[n + 1];
260        //link = new long[n + 1];
261        order = new IntVLA(expected);
262        this.hasher = (hasher == null) ? CrossHash.defaultHasher : hasher;
263    }
264    /**
265     * Creates a new Arrangement with 0.5f as load factor.
266     *
267     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the Arrangement.
268     * @param hasher used to hash items; typically only needed when K is an array, where CrossHash has implementations
269     */
270    public MultiArrangement(final int expected, CrossHash.IHasher hasher) {
271        this(expected, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR, hasher);
272    }
273
274    /**
275     * Creates a new Arrangement with initial expected 16 entries and 0.5f as load factor.
276     */
277    public MultiArrangement(CrossHash.IHasher hasher) {
278        this(DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR, hasher);
279    }
280
281    /**
282     * Creates a new Arrangement using the elements of two parallel arrays.
283     *
284     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new Arrangement.
285     * @param f the load factor.
286     * @param hasher used to hash items; typically only needed when K is an array, where CrossHash has implementations
287     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
288     */
289    public MultiArrangement(final K[] keyArray, final float f, CrossHash.IHasher hasher) {
290        this(keyArray.length, f, hasher);
291
292        for (int i = 0; i < keyArray.length; i++)
293            add(keyArray[i]);
294    }
295    /**
296     * Creates a new Arrangement with 0.5f as load factor using the elements of two parallel arrays.
297     *
298     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new Arrangement.
299     * @param hasher used to hash items; typically only needed when K is an array, where CrossHash has implementations
300     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
301     */
302    public MultiArrangement(final K[] keyArray, CrossHash.IHasher hasher) {
303        this(keyArray, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR, hasher);
304    }
305
306    private int realSize() {
307        return containsNullKey ? size - 1 : size;
308    }
309    private void ensureCapacity(final int capacity) {
310        final int needed = arraySize(capacity, f);
311        if (needed > n)
312            rehash(needed);
313    }
314    private void tryCapacity(final long capacity) {
315        final int needed = (int) Math.min(
316                1 << 30,
317                Math.max(2, HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((long) Math.ceil(capacity
318                        / f))));
319        if (needed > n)
320            rehash(needed);
321    }
322    private int removeEntry(final int pos) {
323        final IntVLA oldValue = value[pos];
324        final int popped = oldValue.pop();
325        if(oldValue.size == 0) --size;
326        fixOrder(pos);
327        shiftKeys(pos);
328        fixValues();
329        if (oldValue.size == 0 && size < (maxFill >>> 2) && n > DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE)
330            rehash(n / 2);
331        return popped;
332    }
333    private int removeNullEntry() {
334        containsNullKey = false;
335        key[n] = null;
336        final IntVLA oldValue = value[n];
337        final int popped = oldValue.pop();
338        if(oldValue.size == 0) --size;
339        fixOrder(n);
340        fixValues();
341        if (oldValue.size == 0 && size < (maxFill >>> 2) && n > DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE)
342            rehash(n / 2);
343        return popped;
344    }
345
346    public void addAll(K[] keyArray) {
347        if (f <= .5)
348            ensureCapacity(keyArray.length); // The resulting map will be sized for
349            // m.size() elements
350        else
351            tryCapacity(size() + keyArray.length); // The resulting map will be
352        int n = keyArray.length;
353        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
354            add(keyArray[i]);
355        }
356    }
357
358    public void addAll(Collection<? extends K> keyArray) {
359        if (f <= .5)
360            ensureCapacity(keyArray.size()); // The resulting map will be sized for
361            // m.size() elements
362        else
363            tryCapacity(size() + keyArray.size()); // The resulting map will be
364        Iterator<? extends K> it = keyArray.iterator();
365        while (it.hasNext())
366            add(it.next());
367    }
368    public void addAllIfAbsent(Map<? extends K, ? extends Integer> m) {
369        if (f <= .5)
370            ensureCapacity(m.size()); // The resulting map will be sized for
371            // m.size() elements
372        else
373            tryCapacity(size() + m.size()); // The resulting map will be
374        int n = m.size();
375        final Iterator<? extends K> i = m
376                .keySet().iterator();
377        while (n-- != 0) {
378            addIfAbsent(i.next());
379        }
380    }
381
382    public void addAllIfAbsent(K[] keyArray) {
383        if (f <= .5)
384            ensureCapacity(keyArray.length);
385        else
386            tryCapacity(size() + keyArray.length);
387        int n = keyArray.length;
388        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
389            addIfAbsent(keyArray[i]);
390        }
391    }
392
393    public void addAllIfAbsent(Collection<? extends K> keyArray) {
394        if (f <= .5)
395            ensureCapacity(keyArray.size());
396        else
397            tryCapacity(size() + keyArray.size());
398        Iterator<? extends K> it = keyArray.iterator();
399        while (it.hasNext())
400            addIfAbsent(it.next());
401    }
402
403    private int insert(final K k) {
404        return insertAt(k, order.size);
405    }
406    private int insertAt(final K k, final int at) {
407        int pos;
408        if (k == null) {
409            if (containsNullKey) {
410                value[n].add(at);
411                order.add(n);
412                return n;
413            }
414            containsNullKey = true;
415            pos = n;
416        } else {
417            K curr;
418            final K[] key = this.key;
419            // The starting point.
420            if ((curr = key[pos = (hasher.hash(k)) & mask]) != null) {
421                if (hasher.areEqual(curr, k)) {
422                    value[pos].add(at);
423                    order.insert(at, pos);
424                    return pos;
425                }
426                while ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) != null)
427                    if (hasher.areEqual(curr, k)) {
428                        value[pos].add(at);
429                        order.insert(at, pos);
430                        return pos;
431                    }
432            }
433        }
434        key[pos] = k;
435        if (size == 0) {
436            first = last = pos;
437        } else {
438            last = pos;
439        }
440        order.insert(at, pos);
441        value[pos] = new IntVLA(8);
442        value[pos].add(at);
443        if (size++ >= maxFill)
444            rehash(arraySize(size + 1, f));
445        return -1;
446    }
447
448    public int add(final K k) {
449        final int pos = insert(k);
450        if (pos < 0)
451            return defRetValue;
452        final IntVLA oldValue = value[pos];
453        oldValue.add(order.size - 1);
454        return order.size - 1;
455    }
456
457    public int addIfAbsent(final K k)
458    {
459        int kPos;
460        if(containsKey(k))
461            return add(k);
462        return -1;
463    }
464
465    protected void fixValues()
466    {
467        for (int i = 0; i < order.size; i++) {
468            value[order.items[i]].clear();
469        }
470        for (int i = 0; i < order.size; i++) {
471            value[order.items[i]].add(i);
472        }
473    }
474
475    /**
476     * Shifts left entries with the specified hash code, starting at the
477     * specified position, and empties the resulting free entry.
478     *
479     * @param pos
480     *            a starting position.
481     */
482    protected final void shiftKeys(int pos) {
483        // Shift entries with the same hash.
484        int last, slot;
485        K curr;
486        final K[] key = this.key;
487        for (;;) {
488            pos = ((last = pos) + 1) & mask;
489            for (;;) {
490                if ((curr = key[pos]) == null) {
491                    key[last] = null;
492                    return;
493                }
494                slot = (hasher.hash(curr))
495                        & mask;
496                if (last <= pos ? last >= slot || slot > pos : last >= slot
497                        && slot > pos)
498                    break;
499                pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
500            }
501            key[last] = curr;
502            fixOrder(pos, last);
503        }
504    }
505    /**
506     * Shifts left entries with the specified hash code, starting at the
507     * specified position, and empties the resulting free entry.
508     *
509     * @param pos
510     *            a starting position.
511     */
512    protected final void shiftKeysValues(int pos) {
513        // Shift entries with the same hash.
514        int last, slot;
515        K curr;
516        IntVLA v;
517        final K[] key = this.key;
518        final IntVLA[] val = this.value;
519        for (;;) {
520            pos = ((last = pos) + 1) & mask;
521            for (;;) {
522                if ((curr = key[pos]) == null) {
523                    key[last] = null;
524                    val[last] = null;
525                    return;
526                }
527                v = val[pos];
528                slot = (hasher.hash(curr))
529                        & mask;
530                if (last <= pos ? last >= slot || slot > pos : last >= slot
531                        && slot > pos)
532                    break;
533                pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
534            }
535            key[last] = curr;
536            val[last] = v;
537            fixOrder(pos, last);
538        }
539    }
540
541    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
542    protected int rem(final Object k) {
543        if (k == null) {
544            if (containsNullKey)
545                return removeNullEntry();
546            return defRetValue;
547        }
548        K curr;
549        final K[] key = this.key;
550        int pos;
551        // The starting point.
552        if ((curr = key[pos = (hasher.hash(k)) & mask]) == null)
553            return defRetValue;
554        if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr))
555            return removeEntry(pos);
556        while (true) {
557            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == null)
558                return defRetValue;
559            if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr))
560                return removeEntry(pos);
561        }
562    }
563    public int remove(Object o)
564    {
565        return rem(o);
566    }
567    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
568    public int removeInt(final Object k) {
569        if (k == null) {
570            if (containsNullKey)
571                return removeNullEntry();
572            return defRetValue;
573        }
574        K curr;
575        final K[] key = this.key;
576        int pos;
577        // The starting point.
578        if ((curr = key[pos = (hasher.hash(k)) & mask]) == null)
579            return defRetValue;
580        if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr))
581            return removeEntry(pos);
582        while (true) {
583            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == null)
584                return defRetValue;
585            if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr))
586                return removeEntry(pos);
587        }
588    }
589    /**
590     * Removes the mapping associated with the first key in iteration order.
591     *
592     * @return the value previously associated with the first key in iteration
593     *         order.
594     * @throws NoSuchElementException
595     *             is this map is empty.
596     */
597    public K removeFirst() {
598        return removeAt(0);
599
600    }
601    /**
602     * Removes the mapping associated with the last key in iteration order.
603     *
604     * @return the value previously associated with the last key in iteration
605     *         order.
606     * @throws NoSuchElementException
607     *             is this map is empty.
608     */
609    public K removeLast() {
610        return removeAt(order.size - 1);
611
612    }
613    private void moveIndexToFirst(final int i) {
614        if(order.size <= 1 || first == i)
615            return;
616        order.moveToFirst(i);
617        if (last == i) {
618            last = order.peek();
619            //last = (int) (link[i] >>> 32);
620            // Special case of SET_NEXT( link[ last ], -1 );
621            //link[last] |= -1 & 0xFFFFFFFFL;
622        }/* else {
623            final long linki = link[i];
624            final int prev = (int) (linki >>> 32);
625            final int next = (int) linki;
626            link[prev] ^= ((link[prev] ^ (linki & 0xFFFFFFFFL)) & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
627            link[next] ^= ((link[next] ^ (linki & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L)) & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L);
628        }
629        link[first] ^= ((link[first] ^ ((i & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32)) & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L);
630        link[i] = ((-1 & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32) | (first & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
631        */
632        first = i;
633        fixValues();
634    }
635    private void moveIndexToLast(final int i) {
636        if(order.size <= 1 || last == i)
637            return;
638        order.moveToLast(i);
639        if (first == i) {
640            first = order.get(0);
641            //first = (int) link[i];
642            // Special case of SET_PREV( link[ first ], -1 );
643            //link[first] |= (-1 & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32;
644        } /*else {
645            final long linki = link[i];
646            final int prev = (int) (linki >>> 32);
647            final int next = (int) linki;
648            link[prev] ^= ((link[prev] ^ (linki & 0xFFFFFFFFL)) & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
649            link[next] ^= ((link[next] ^ (linki & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L)) & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L);
650        }
651        link[last] ^= ((link[last] ^ (i & 0xFFFFFFFFL)) & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
652        link[i] = ((last & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32) | (-1 & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
653        */
654        last = i;
655        fixValues();
656    }
657
658    /**
659     * Different from the typical get method; clears the non-null IntVLA, container, and fills it with any positions
660     * associated with k in this MultiArrangement. If you want to append to container instead of clearing it, use
661     * {@link #append(IntVLA, Object)}.
662     * @param container a non-null IntVLA; will be modified! Even if no entries are added, will be cleared
663     * @param k a K object or something that can be treated as one to search for
664     * @return the number of items added to container; 0 if none were added
665     */
666    public int get(final IntVLA container, final Object k) {
667        container.clear();
668        return append(container, k);
669    }
670    /**
671     * Different from the typical get method; adds to the non-null IntVLA, container, filling with any positions
672     * associated with k in this MultiArrangement. If you want a more convenient method for the case where you want
673     * container to hold only the items associated with k (discarding old contents), use {@link #get(IntVLA, Object)}.
674     * @param container a non-null IntVLA; will be modified unless nothing is associated with k
675     * @param k a K object or something that can be treated as one to search for
676     * @return the number of items added to container; 0 if none were added
677     */
678    public int append(final IntVLA container, final Object k) {
679        if (k == null)
680        {
681            if(containsNullKey) {
682                container.addAll(value[n]);
683                return value[n].size;
684            }
685            else
686                return 0;
687        }
688        K curr;
689        final K[] key = this.key;
690        int pos;
691        // The starting point.
692        if ((curr = key[pos = (hasher.hash(k)) & mask]) == null)
693            return 0;
694        if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr)) {
695            container.addAll(value[pos]);
696            return value[pos].size;
697        }
698        // There's always an unused entry.
699        while (true) {
700            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == null)
701                return 0;
702            if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr))
703            {
704                container.addAll(value[pos]);
705                return value[pos].size;
706            }
707        }
708    }
709
710    public boolean containsKey(final Object k) {
711        if (k == null)
712            return containsNullKey;
713        K curr;
714        final K[] key = this.key;
715        int pos;
716        // The starting point.
717        if ((curr = key[pos = (hasher.hash(k)) & mask]) == null)
718            return false;
719        if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr))
720            return true;
721        // There's always an unused entry.
722        while (true) {
723            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == null)
724                return false;
725            if (hasher.areEqual(k, curr))
726                return true;
727        }
728    }
729    public boolean containsValue(final int v) {
730        return v >= 0 && v < order.size;
731    }
732    public boolean containsValue(final Object ov) {
733        return ov != null && containsValue(((Integer) ov).intValue());
734    }
735    /*
736     * Removes all elements from this map.
737     *
738     * <P>To increase object reuse, this method does not change the table size.
739     * If you want to reduce the table size, you must use {@link #trim()}.
740     */
741    public void clear() {
742        if (size == 0)
743            return;
744        size = 0;
745        containsNullKey = false;
746        Arrays.fill(key, null);
747        Arrays.fill(value, null);
748        first = last = -1;
749        order.clear();
750    }
751
752    public int size() {
753        return order.size;
754    }
755
756    public boolean isEmpty() {
757        return size == 0;
758    }
759
760    /**
761     * Returns an iterator over elements of type {@code T}.
762     *
763     * @return an Iterator.
764     */
765    @Override
766    public Iterator<K> iterator() {
767        return new KeyIterator();
768    }
769
770    protected void fixOrder(final int i) {
771        if (size == 0) {
772            order.clear();
773            first = last = -1;
774            return;
775        }
776        order.removeValue(i);
777        if (first == i) {
778            first = order.get(0);
779            //first = (int) link[i];
780            /*
781            if (0 <= first) {
782                // Special case of SET_PREV( link[ first ], -1 )
783                link[first] |= (-1 & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32;
784            }
785            return;
786            */
787        }
788        if (last == i) {
789            last = order.peek();
790            //last = (int) (link[i] >>> 32);
791            /*if (0 <= last) {
792                // Special case of SET_NEXT( link[ last ], -1 )
793                link[last] |= -1 & 0xFFFFFFFFL;
794            }
795            return;
796            */
797        }
798        /*
799        final long linki = link[i];
800        final int prev = (int) (linki >>> 32);
801        final int next = (int) linki;
802        link[prev] ^= ((link[prev] ^ (linki & 0xFFFFFFFFL)) & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
803        link[next] ^= ((link[next] ^ (linki & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L)) & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L);
804        */
805    }
806
807    /**
808     * Modifies the link vector for a shift from s to d.
809     * <br>
810     * This method will complete in logarithmic time or better.
811     *
812     * @param s the source position.
813     * @param d the destination position.
814     */
815    protected void fixOrder(int s, int d) {
816        if (order.size == 1) {
817            first = last = d;
818            // Special case of SET_UPPER_LOWER( link[ d ], -1, -1 )
819            //link[d] = -1L;
820            order.set(0, d);
821        }
822        else if (first == s) {
823            first = d;
824            order.set(0, d);
825            //link[(int) link[s]] ^= ((link[(int) link[s]] ^ ((d & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32)) & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L);
826            //link[d] = link[s];
827        }
828        else if (last == s) {
829            last = d;
830            order.set(order.size - 1, d);
831            //link[(int) (link[s] >>> 32)] ^= ((link[(int) (link[s] >>> 32)] ^ (d & 0xFFFFFFFFL)) & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
832            //link[d] = link[s];
833        }
834        else
835        {
836            order.set(order.indexOf(s), d);
837        }
838        /*
839        final long links = link[s];
840        final int prev = (int) (links >>> 32);
841        final int next = (int) links;
842        link[prev] ^= ((link[prev] ^ (d & 0xFFFFFFFFL)) & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
843        link[next] ^= ((link[next] ^ ((d & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32)) & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L);
844        link[d] = links;
845        */
846    }
847
848    /**
849     * Returns the first key of this map in iteration order.
850     *
851     * @return the first key in iteration order.
852     */
853    public K firstKey() {
854        if (size == 0)
855            throw new NoSuchElementException();
856        return key[first];
857    }
858    /**
859     * Returns the last key of this map in iteration order.
860     *
861     * @return the last key in iteration order.
862     */
863    public K lastKey() {
864        if (size == 0)
865            throw new NoSuchElementException();
866        return key[last];
867    }
868    /**
869     * Retains in this collection only elements from the given collection.
870     *
871     * @param c a collection.
872     * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the
873     * call.
874     */
875    public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
876        boolean retVal = false;
877        int n = order.size;
878        while (n-- != 0) {
879            if (!c.contains(key[order.get(n)])) {
880                removeAt(n);
881                retVal = true;
882            }
883        }
884        return retVal;
885    }
886
887    public Comparator<? super K> comparator() {
888        return null;
889    }
890    public SortedMap<K, Integer> tailMap(K from) {
891        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
892    }
893    public SortedMap<K, Integer> headMap(K to) {
894        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
895    }
896    public SortedMap<K, Integer> subMap(K from, K to) {
897        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
898    }
899    /**
900     * A list iterator over a MultiArrangement.
901     *
902     * <P>
903     * This class provides a list iterator over a MultiArrangement. The
904     * constructor runs in constant time.
905     */
906    private class MapIterator {
907        /**
908         * The entry that will be returned by the next call to
909         * {@link ListIterator#previous()} (or <code>null</code> if no
910         * previous entry exists).
911         */
912        int prev = -1;
913        /**
914         * The entry that will be returned by the next call to
915         * {@link ListIterator#next()} (or <code>null</code> if no
916         * next entry exists).
917         */
918        int next = -1;
919        /**
920         * The last entry that was returned (or -1 if we did not iterate or used
921         * {@link Iterator#remove()}).
922         */
923        int curr = -1;
924        /**
925         * The current index (in the sense of a {@link ListIterator}).
926         * Note that this value is not meaningful when this iterator has been
927         * created using the nonempty constructor.
928         */
929        int index = 0;
930        private MapIterator() {
931            next = first;
932            index = 0;
933        }
934        /*
935        private MapIterator(final K from) {
936            if (((from) == null)) {
937                if (containsNullKey) {
938                    next = (int) link[n];
939                    prev = n;
940                    return;
941                } else
942                    throw new NoSuchElementException("The key null"
943                            + " does not belong to this map.");
944            }
945            if (((key[last]) != null && (key[last]).equals(from))) {
946                prev = last;
947                index = size;
948                return;
949            }
950            // The starting point.
951            int pos = (((from).hashCode()))
952                    & mask;
953            // There's always an unused entry.
954            while (!((key[pos]) == null)) {
955                if (((key[pos]).equals(from))) {
956                    // Note: no valid index known.
957                    next = (int) link[pos];
958                    prev = pos;
959                    return;
960                }
961                pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
962            }
963            throw new NoSuchElementException("The key " + from
964                    + " does not belong to this map.");
965        }*/
966        public boolean hasNext() {
967            return next != -1;
968        }
969        public boolean hasPrevious() {
970            return prev != -1;
971        }
972        private void ensureIndexKnown() {
973            if (index >= 0)
974                return;
975            if (prev == -1) {
976                index = 0;
977                return;
978            }
979            if (next == -1) {
980                index = order.size;
981                return;
982            }
983            index = 0;
984            /*while (pos != prev) {
985                pos = (int) link[pos];
986                index++;
987            }*/
988        }
989        public int nextIndex() {
990            ensureIndexKnown();
991            return index + 1;
992        }
993        public int previousIndex() {
994            ensureIndexKnown();
995            return index - 1;
996        }
997        public int nextEntry() {
998            if (!hasNext())
999                throw new NoSuchElementException();
1000            curr = next;
1001            if(++index >= order.size)
1002                next = -1;
1003            else
1004                next = order.get(index);//(int) link[curr];
1005            prev = curr;
1006            return curr;
1007        }
1008        public int previousEntry() {
1009            if (!hasPrevious())
1010                throw new NoSuchElementException();
1011            curr = prev;
1012            if(--index < 1)
1013                prev = -1;
1014            else
1015                prev = order.get(index - 1);
1016            //prev = (int) (link[curr] >>> 32);
1017            next = curr;
1018            return curr;
1019        }
1020        public void remove() {
1021            ensureIndexKnown();
1022            if (curr == -1)
1023                throw new IllegalStateException();
1024            if (curr == prev) {
1025                                /*
1026                                 * If the last operation was a next(), we are removing an entry
1027                                 * that precedes the current index, and thus we must decrement
1028                                 * it.
1029                                 */
1030                if(--index >= 1)
1031                    prev = order.get(index - 1); //(int) (link[curr] >>> 32);
1032                else
1033                    prev = -1;
1034            } else {
1035                if(index < order.size - 1)
1036                    next = order.get(index + 1);
1037                else
1038                    next = -1;
1039            }
1040            /*
1041                         * Now we manually fix the pointers. Because of our knowledge of
1042                         * next and prev, this is going to be faster than calling
1043                         * fixOrder().
1044                         */
1045            if (prev == -1)
1046                first = next;
1047            if (next == -1)
1048                last = prev;
1049            final IntVLA iv = value[order.removeIndex(index)];
1050            iv.removeValue(index);
1051            if(iv.size == 0)
1052                size--;
1053            int last, slot, pos = curr;
1054            curr = -1;
1055            if (pos == n) {
1056                containsNullKey = false;
1057                key[n] = null;
1058            } else {
1059                K curr;
1060                final K[] key = MultiArrangement.this.key;
1061                // We have to horribly duplicate the shiftKeys() code because we
1062                // need to update next/prev.
1063                for (;;) {
1064                    pos = ((last = pos) + 1) & mask;
1065                    for (;;) {
1066                        if ((curr = key[pos]) == null) {
1067                            key[last] = null;
1068                            fixValues();
1069                            return;
1070                        }
1071                        slot = (hasher.hash(curr)) & mask;
1072                        if (last <= pos
1073                                ? last >= slot || slot > pos
1074                                : last >= slot && slot > pos)
1075                            break;
1076                        pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
1077                    }
1078                    key[last] = curr;
1079                    if (next == pos)
1080                        next = last;
1081                    if (prev == pos)
1082                        prev = last;
1083                    fixOrder(pos, last);
1084                }
1085            }
1086        }
1087        public int skip(final int n) {
1088            int i = n;
1089            while (i-- != 0 && hasNext())
1090                nextEntry();
1091            return n - i - 1;
1092        }
1093        public int back(final int n) {
1094            int i = n;
1095            while (i-- != 0 && hasPrevious())
1096                previousEntry();
1097            return n - i - 1;
1098        }
1099    }
1100
1101    /**
1102     * An iterator on keys.
1103     * <p>
1104     * <P>We simply override the {@link ListIterator#next()}/{@link ListIterator#previous()} methods (and possibly their type-specific counterparts) so that they return keys
1105     * instead of entries.
1106     */
1107    public final class KeyIterator extends MapIterator implements Iterator<K>, Serializable {
1108        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1109        public K previous() {
1110            return key[previousEntry()];
1111        }
1112        public void set(K k) {
1113            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1114        }
1115        public void add(K k) {
1116            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1117        }
1118        public KeyIterator() {}
1119        public K next() {
1120            return key[nextEntry()];
1121        }
1122        public void remove() { super.remove(); }
1123    }
1124
1125    public final class KeyList extends AbstractList<K> implements Serializable {
1126        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1127
1128        public KeyIterator iterator() {
1129            return new KeyIterator();
1130        }
1131
1132        public int size() {
1133            return order.size;
1134        }
1135
1136        public void clear() {
1137            MultiArrangement.this.clear();
1138        }
1139
1140        public K first() {
1141            if (size == 0) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1142            return key[first];
1143        }
1144
1145        public K last() {
1146            if (size == 0) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1147            return key[last];
1148        }
1149
1150        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1151        @Override
1152        public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a) {
1153            if (a == null || a.length < size()) a = (T[]) new Object[size()];
1154            unwrap(iterator(), a);
1155            return a;
1156        }
1157
1158        /**
1159         * Always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1160         */
1161        public boolean remove(Object ok) {
1162            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot remove from the key set directly");
1163        }
1164
1165        /**
1166         * Always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1167         */
1168        public boolean add(final K o) {
1169            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot add to the key set directly");
1170        }
1171
1172        /**
1173         * {@inheritDoc}
1174         *
1175         * @param index
1176         * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {@inheritDoc}
1177         */
1178        @Override
1179        public K get(int index) {
1180            return keyAt(index);
1181        }
1182
1183        /**
1184         * Delegates to the corresponding type-specific method.
1185         */
1186        public boolean contains(final Object o) {
1187            return containsKey(o);
1188        }
1189
1190        /**
1191         * Checks whether this collection contains all elements from the given type-specific collection.
1192         *
1193         * @param c a type-specific collection.
1194         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection contains all elements of the argument.
1195         */
1196        public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c) {
1197            final Iterator<?> i = c.iterator();
1198            int n = c.size();
1199            while (n-- != 0)
1200                if (!contains(i.next())) return false;
1201            return true;
1202        }
1203
1204        /**
1205         * Retains in this collection only elements from the given type-specific collection.
1206         *
1207         * @param c a type-specific collection.
1208         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the call.
1209         */
1210        public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
1211            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot remove from the key set directly");
1212        }
1213
1214        /**
1215         * Remove from this collection all elements in the given type-specific collection.
1216         *
1217         * @param c a type-specific collection.
1218         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the call.
1219         */
1220        public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {
1221            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot remove from the key set directly");
1222        }
1223
1224        public Object[] toArray() {
1225            final Object[] a = new Object[size()];
1226            objectUnwrap(iterator(), a);
1227            return a;
1228        }
1229
1230        /**
1231         * Always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
1232         * @param c disregarded; always throws Exception
1233         * @return nothing; always throws Exception
1234         */
1235        public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends K> c) {
1236            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot add to the key set directly");
1237        }
1238
1239        @Override
1240        public boolean equals(final Object o) {
1241            if (o == this)
1242                return true;
1243            if (!(o instanceof List))
1244                return false;
1245
1246            KeyIterator e1 = iterator();
1247            ListIterator<?> e2 = ((List<?>) o).listIterator();
1248            while (e1.hasNext() && e2.hasNext()) {
1249                K o1 = e1.next();
1250                Object o2 = e2.next();
1251                if (!(o1==null ? o2==null : o1.equals(o2)))
1252                    return false;
1253            }
1254            return !(e1.hasNext() || e2.hasNext());
1255        }
1256        /**
1257         * Unwraps an iterator into an array starting at a given offset for a given number of elements.
1258         * <p>
1259         * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned, up to a maximum of <code>length</code>, in the given array starting at <code>offset</code>. The
1260         * number of actually unwrapped elements is returned (it may be less than <code>max</code> if the iterator emits less than <code>max</code> elements).
1261         *
1262         * @param i      a type-specific iterator.
1263         * @param array  an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1264         * @param offset the first element of the array to be returned.
1265         * @param max    the maximum number of elements to unwrap.
1266         * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1267         */
1268        public int unwrap(final KeyIterator i, final Object[] array, int offset, final int max) {
1269            if (max < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The maximum number of elements (" + max + ") is negative");
1270            if (offset < 0 || offset + max > array.length) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
1271            int j = max;
1272            while (j-- != 0 && i.hasNext())
1273                array[offset++] = i.next();
1274            return max - j - 1;
1275        }
1276
1277        /**
1278         * Unwraps an iterator into an array.
1279         * <p>
1280         * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned in the given array. The iteration will stop when the iterator has no more elements or when the end
1281         * of the array has been reached.
1282         *
1283         * @param i     a type-specific iterator.
1284         * @param array an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1285         * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1286         */
1287        public int unwrap(final KeyIterator i, final Object[] array) {
1288            return unwrap(i, array, 0, array.length);
1289        }
1290
1291        public boolean isEmpty() {
1292            return size() == 0;
1293        }
1294
1295        @Override
1296        public String toString() {
1297            final StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder();
1298            final KeyIterator i = iterator();
1299            int n = size();
1300            boolean first = true;
1301            s.append("{");
1302            while (n-- != 0) {
1303                if (first) first = false;
1304                else s.append(", ");
1305                s.append(i.next());
1306            }
1307            s.append("}");
1308            return s.toString();
1309        }
1310    }
1311
1312    public KeyList keyList() {
1313        if (keys == null) keys = new KeyList();
1314        return keys;
1315    }
1316
1317    public ArrayList<K> keysAsArrayList()
1318    {
1319        ArrayList<K> al = new ArrayList<>(order.size);
1320        for (int i = 0; i < order.size; i++) {
1321            al.add(keyAt(i));
1322        }
1323        return al;
1324    }
